clinical_study.brief_title: Dual Specificity CD19 and CD22 CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for CD19+CD22+ Relapsed and Refractory Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: The Safety and Efficacy of Dual Specificity CD19 and CD22 CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for CD19+CD22+ Relapsed and Refractory Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with relapsed or refractory lymphoma often develop resistance to chemotherapy. Chimeric antigen receptor-modified T cell (CART) therapy showed promising effect in B-cell malignancies these years. CD19 and CD22 are proteins expressed on the surface of the lymphoma cells in patients with CD19+CD22+ lymphoma. The CAR enables the T-cells to recognize and kill the tumor cell through recognition of CD19 and CD22. This is a phase 2 trial to study the safety and efficacy of dual specificity CD19 and CD22 CAR-T cell immunotherapy for CD19+CD22+ relapsed and refractory lymphoma.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of complete remission and patial remission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, day 4, week 1, week 3, week 4, month 2, month 12 after CAR-T cells were infused
